com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol.classpath

Class Handler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.URLStreamHandler
      • com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol.classpath.Handler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Handler, Handler

    public class Handler
extends URLStreamHandler
    This is used to register a URL handler for url schema/protocol "classpath", to load files from classpath. This will allow html linkref to find files within the compiled code. Example: format is "classpath://" + javapackage "/" + filename URL url = new URL("classpath://com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.css/html.css"); Ex: !!! NOTE !!!: must call static method "register()" or "jwsregister" to have this URL Handler used/registered.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Handler() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected InetAddress getHostAddress(URL u) 
      static void jwsregister()
      This should be used for JWS applications.
      static void main(String[] args) 
      protected URLConnection openConnection(URL u) 
      static boolean register()
      This will need to set the system property, which is the same as runtime setting: -Djava.protocol.handler.pkgs=com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol Note: for JWS, use method jwsregister instead, since jws uses a classloader that can not be accessed.

      • Methods inherited from class java.net.URLStreamHandler

        equals, getDefaultPort, hashCode, hostsEqual, openConnection, parseURL, sameFile, setURL, setURL, toExternalForm

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public static boolean register()
        This will need to set the system property, which is the same as runtime setting: -Djava.protocol.handler.pkgs=com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol Note: for JWS, use method jwsregister instead, since jws uses a classloader that can not be accessed.

      • jwsregister

        public static void jwsregister()
        This should be used for JWS applications. (see notes above) it is also necessary to call: System.setSecurityManager(null); // needed for setting OA URL protocol handlers
